Pre-Game Insights: Coach Walid Regragui spoke of the effectiveness and the limits of the offensive strategy he used against Gabon.
Regragui pledged to give opportunities to young players during today’s match to gain in confidence and maturity as they vie to represent Morocco on the continental stage.
The Atlas Lions are well aware that no match is a walkover in Africa, a lesson learned from experiences in both previous AFCON tournaments and qualifiers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will take place at 8 p.m., bringing key football players as part of coach Walid Regragui’s lineup.
Both Morocco’s Arriyadia sports channel and beIn Sports 1 broadcast tonight’s game.
Others: Morocco will face Lesotho in an AFCON qualifier game later today.
The latest continental campaign in Cote d’Ivoire ended in bitter disappointment for Morocco, with the Atlas Lions suffering an early exit following a 2-0 defeat to South Africa in the round of 16.
